evidence.text:
SAMUEL: Oh! I chose you as my mentor.
SAMUEL: I chose you as my mentor.
ROMY: I’m not a part of that program.
SAMUEL: You are. You’re on the list. I got an email and I clicked on your name. So- You’re on the list.

SAMUEL: I got an email saying they scheduled the first session.
SAMUEL: The ten minute introduction meeting?
ROMY: Who decided that I’m part of that mentor program by the way?

ROMY: I started my own company five years later with the goal to change the global supply chain forever. I wanted to automate repetitive tasks, to give people their time back so they can spend it in a fulfilling way–

SAMUEL: They said we are supposed to meet weekly, but you didn't answer the email. They sent an email.
ROMY: I have to go- I have an appointment.
SAMUEL: It’s very easy. The email has a link. You just click on a date and a time for the second appointment- It will pop up in your calendar-
SAMUEL: Listen, if you don’t want to be my mentor, I totally understand. I’ll ask someone else, but I do want one. They say it makes a huge difference. There’s lots of other people I can ask, so-

SAMUEL: Get on your knees.
SAMUEL: Hurt me? I think I have power over you, not the other way around. I mean, one call and you lose everything. Right?
SAMUEL: Does that turn you on, when I say that?
SAMUEL: Get on your knees.
SAMUEL: Please take your clothes off-
SAMUEL: Would you mind getting on your hands and knees for me?

ROMY: I thought you said it had to be consensual.
SAMUEL: Yes, that’s what consent is Romy! That’s what it is. You have to agree to it. Both parties have to agree to it.
SAMUEL: Take your panties off.
SAMUEL: Open your legs.
SAMUEL: Ok. You want to take your dress off for me now? So I can see you?
SAMUEL: You’re so beautiful.

ROMY: Are you dating her?
SAMUEL: Isn’t that man in the living room your husband?
ROMY: I don’t want you to see other women. You’re mine-
